meta.title: From RUBY to TUESDAY
meta.author: Sandy Weisz and Mao Reynolds
meta.message: This week’s Raddles are inspired by songs by the Rolling Stones. Today’s is “Ruby Tuesday,” released in 1966 with “Let’s Spend the Night Together.” The restaurant chain Ruby Tuesday, which formed a corporation thirty years later in 1996, took its name from the song, though they don’t seem to have collaborated with the band for any menu items (really, no “Beast of Burden” burgers?).
